ARABIC: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ أَرَءَيْتَ ٱلَّذِى يُكَذِّبُ بِٱلدِّينِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Have you seen him who denies the deen?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: HAVE YOU SEEN him who denies the Day of Judgement?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Did you see him who gives the lie to the Reward and Punishment of the Hereafter?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Have you seen the one who calls the religion a lie?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Just look at him, who belies the religion!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Have you seen him who denies Ad-Din
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Have you considered him who calls the judgment a lie?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Hast thou seen him who cries lies to the Doom?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Hast thou observed him who belieth religion?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Have you seen one who denies the Day of Judgement?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Beholdest thou him who belieth the Requital?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Did you see him who denies the Retribution?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Seest thou one who denies the Judgment (to come)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Have you seen him who denies the Recompense?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Have you seen he who belied the Recompense?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Have you considered him who denies the religion?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Have you seen the one who denies the Recompense?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [107:1] Have you seen him who denies the Judgement?, the Requital and the Reckoning, that is to say, ‘Do you know who he is?’ If you do not know him then:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said regarding the interpretation of Allah's 774 saying (Hast thou observed him who belieth religion?): '(Hast thou observed him who belieth religion?) And it is said this means: have you observed him who belies the Day of Reckoning? This is in reference to 'As Ibn Wa'il al-Sahmi.
